intro: Trichopteryx lanata, commonly known as the hairy trichopteryx, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Trichopteryx lanata is often found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
